code it.title: Codolympic

If you have started many a day with #include, said "HELLO WORLD!" in a bunch of different languages or if you believe coding is therapeutic, look no further, SSN Invente presents you with Codolympic.

Winners get internships at
rules: Exactly 2 members in a team (Individual participation is not allowed)

code it.title: SciTech Quiz
code it.description: Ever felt that “Tcha, it's at the tip of my tongue!” feeling when asked to answer a question? Do you walk around with your nose buried (no, not literally) in the latest developments from the world of technology? Have you what it takes to trump every other techno-freak, gadget geek, and whizkid out there in a frenetic battle of quizzing? If your answer to zero or more of the above questions is 1 (That's “Yes” for you CS neophytes), be there on the 10th of September at Invente '16 for the Tech Quiz. Good luck, and may the quizzing gods bless all your fluke guesses with +10!

code it.title: Triathlon
code it.description: Is coding your cup of tea? Can you code anything right from simple hello world to scenarios? Do you like winning events? Then Triathlon is ready to give you its entire prize money! After all, a perfect blend of aptitude, coding and presence of mind is all that you need to win this three-round event. Well, what are you waiting for, get set code!

Round 1:

Round 2:

Round 1: This is a prelims round which will be a pen and paper test.

Round 2: The finals will be a group event. All the teams will have to encrypt a few messages and other teams would be given the chance in a round robin fashion to decrypt them. The teams with most points shall be awarded prizes.

bits please.title: Appstronaut
bits please.description: Interested in becoming an Appstronaut? Let’s gear up our space shuttle and explore the App Galaxy. Together we can reach new heights and reveal limitless opportunities. bits please.title: SSN Nuggets
bits please.description: Are you into data analytics? Do you find patterns in large datasets that others fail to notice? Do you think you can make better predictions than the astrologer? Then this is the event for you, come and indulge in some data analytics fun and win fun prizes.

The duration of the event will be 1.5 - 2 hours. After 1.5 hrs teams have to provide a brief explanation of what they've done, and their next plan of action. This explanation will give them nugget points which will play a major role in the final decision and in clearance of tie breakers.

  2. R + R studio + add any packages you want
  3. Weka

wired.title: Project Display

General Rules:

wired.title: Solder It
wired.description:
“Wish to nail it? Board it!”

Some people accidentally short circuit their electronics, feel the tiny shock of electricity running through them, and run away from their devices. Others thrive on breaking the circuit, understanding why it happened, and how to fix it. Their dreams are filled with resistors and capacitors forming intricate networks as beautiful as spider webs in the sunlight. If you belong to this rare breed of dreamers, then you are in for a treat. Come to Solder It at Invente, and you will see the amateur enthusiasts rubbing shoulders with the most formidable professionals at soldering circuits. Perhaps you will surprise us all with your soldering skills! Only time will tell!
rules:
General Rules:
  • Use of mobile phones and other electronic gadgets is not allowed. Participants can be disqualified for any such use.
  • Judges decision is final.
  • 2 – 3 members per team. Organizers will help lone wolves find their pack!
  • Soldering kits and electronic components will be provided.
Round 1 (Prelims): This will be a Q&A based round. Participants will be tested on their technical skills.
Round 2: This is a design round. Participants will be asked to design a circuit for given criteria on the spot.
Final Round: Top eight teams from round 2 will be tested on their soldering skills. Teams will be soldering their circuit on a PCB dot board.

Judging Criteria:
  • Circuit functioning.
  • Practicality of circuit implementation.
wired.venue: LIC Laboratory ECE Department (East Wing - Ground Floor)

wired.title: Pantomath 2.0
rules:
General Rules:
  • This is a semi-technical event with three rounds.
  • 2 – 3 members per team.
Round 1 (Lucky Spin): Each team will have to answer 12 MCQs from a topic chosen by a lucky spin. Top 12 teams make it to the next round.

Round 2 (Crack the Enigma):

  • A binary algorithm is displayed on the projector and the encryption algorithm runs quickly on the screen.
  • A crucial diagram is given to one member of the team and it must be described to the other team members. The other team members must draw the diagram on paper.
  • Identify the circuit on the slide.

  • Common questions to all branches.

wired.title: Domain Masters
rules: Each team has two-three members.
Top six-eight teams from round 1 will be selected for the final round.

Round 1 (Preliminary):
  • The event would test the ability of the participants to think and conquer the challenges from the major domains of Electronics Engineering.
  • The first round would test the basics of all the domains of ECE namely Embedded system , Signal and Image processing , RF and Microwave Engineering and Computer Networks.

  • The top six-eight teams will be selected for the final round.

Round 2 (Finals):
  • The finals will have a series of task/challenges from each domain namely Signal processing , Embedded , Networks , RF and Microwave.
  • The objective of this contest is to find the Engineering students who are well versed in all domains of Electronics.
  • The team which has achieved/covered more in the given time will be rewarded.

power up.title: Line Follower
power up.description:
There's a time when the operation of the machine becomes so odious yet so enthralling, that as engineers you can't not take part!
And you've got to put your bodies upon the gears and upon the wheel as you weave through the dark trail.
Fall in Line. Survive the track. Complete the course.
In this trial of time, you have three lives. Make them count.
rules: Problem Statement: To design an autonomous line follower robot capable of traversing a given track. The track is a black, 3 cm wide line against on a white background. It will have checkpoints indicated by markers. If the bot moves out of the track, it must be placed at the nearest checkpoint. The start and stop positions will be a black box (5 x 5 cm).

Robot Specification:
  • The robot should be controlled using a microcontroller.
  • The dimensions of the bot should not exceed 30 cm x 30 cm x 30 cm.
  • The potential difference between any two points in the robot should not exceed 12V at any given point in time.
  • The robot must be started manually using a switch.

General Rules:
  • The event will comprise of two rounds Prelims and Finals. The top five teams to complete the preliminary will qualify for the final round.
  • Each team can have a maximum of 4 members
  • The robot must be completely autonomous.
  • Each team will be given two trials for both prelims and finals. The organizers can reduce the number of trials in case of time constraints. The better trial of the two will be considered.
  • Only one member of the team will be allowed to intervene and points will be reduced for each intervention.
  • Calibration time of one hour will be given before the start of the event.
  • Participants must bring their own components, laptops and software if they wish to make changes on the day of the event. No components will be provided.
  • NXG and readymade bots are not allowed.
  • The bot must complete the track within five minutes.
  • A bot that does not meet the specifications or damages the track in any way will be disqualified
  • The time measured and points awarded by the organizers are final. In case of any dispute, the organizers will have the final say.
  • The organizers reserve the right to change any of the rules mentioned above. In such a case, the participants will be informed of the changes beforehand.

Round 1 (Preliminary):
  • The track will be a simple one with obstacles, acute angle turns and markers
  • It will have checkpoints indicated by markers and obstacles. If the bot moves out of the track, it must be placed at the previous checkpoint
  • The bot must beep once when it crosses a marker.
  • The bot must stop and beep on encountering an obstacle. The beeping must continue till thr obstacle is removed.
  • The bot should start and stop at the same point.

Round 2 (Finals):
  • Final round consists of five zones.
  • Participants need to complete all five zones.

Zone Specifications:
  • Zone 1:
      This zone is an S-like curve with a T in the starting
  • Zone 2:
      Zone 2 consists of strips of width 3 cm and length 10cm on both the sides of the arena. The bot has to count the number of strips on the left and right side of the line. After the 90 degree turn, the bot has to stop at the + on the line and glow the LEDs for 2 seconds.
      Number of blue LEDs to glow for 2 seconds at the + = (left side strips) - (right side strips)
  • Zone 3:
      Zone 3 consists of two black strips of width 3cm and distance between them is 3cm. The bot has to move through the center. It is then followed by a series of 90 degree turns.
  • Zone 4:
      It is then followed by a curve with a mild ramp
  • Zone 5:
      Zone 5 is a straight line with/without an object in its end. If there is an object in the end, the the bot has to make a left turn and finish the match. If there is no object in the end, then it has to make a right turn and finish the match. The object is some distance from the end of the straight line. The decision of object placement depends upon the organizer.

power up.title: Bridge Balancio

RULES:

FINALS:

Steer your way through the different levels of electrical disdain. Every fault will run you into the ground. Beautifully intricate. Compellingly riveting.
CAN YOU BRAVE THE MAZE?

power up.title: BOMB SQUAD
power up.description:
“War doesn’t determine who’s right. Only who’s left.”
Armed with nothing but pliers and a deadline. You risk the lives of… none.It’s a game of wit. Think fast. Act faster.Decrypt and Defuse.Else Diffuse.
TIME’S RUNNING OUT...
Decide. Defy. Defuse.
rules:
RULES:

FINALS:

Being intrigued by the world around us is quite natural. After all, it’s a part of being an engineer.
Stay hungry! Stay Foolish!

gear up.title: Bottle Rocketrix
gear up.description:
It is D-Day, nerves all around, last minute checks. Countdown- 5..4..3..2..1..BLAST OFF. Is it a bird? Is it a plane? It’s a BOTTLE ROCKET?!

Back with a bang and a bottle to give wings to your dreams! Come, watch them soar.
rules: A minimum of two and a maximum of three members are allowed per team.

Maximum bottle capacity is 2500 ml (violation of which will result in disqualification).
Only single stage rockets are allowed, any modifications must be validated by the event head. Information regarding the modifications must be intimated well in advance. (Judge's decision is final)
Pressure range is pre-determined (40-45 psi)
Time allotted to each team is 3 minutes
Judgement will be based on the distance travelled by the rocket and the deviation from the fixed trajectory
Use of sheet metal for the rockets is prohibited.
In case of any discrepancies, the decision of the event co-ordinators will be deemed final.

gear up.title: Robo Wars
gear up.description:
Is your anger coming in the way of your friendship? Do you have the urge to prove your mettle to your peers? Have you always wanted to punch someone till you draw blood?

Don’t do that.

We provide you instead with a platform to relish the pleasure of watching two months of your opponents’ hard work get blown to smithereens.

ADDED BONUS- You won’t have to serve jail term, because robots don’t have rights (yet).
rules: A team may consist of a maximum of 3 participants.
Design and construct a remote or wired controlled bot capable of fighting a one on one tournament.

General Rules:
  • The competition will be played on a knock-out basis consisting of 2 players at a time. The maximum duration of each round will be 5 minutes. Any team that is not ready at the time specified will be disqualified from the competition.
  • The machine will be checked for safety before the competition. Any robot found unsafe to other participants and spectators will be disqualified.
  • The organizers reserve the rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any, will be highlighted on the website and notified to the registered teams.
  • Violation of any the above rules will lead to disqualification.
  • Judges’ decision shall be treated as final and binding on all.
Note: The bot should conform to the specified conditions.

Safety Rules:
  • Compliance with all event rules is mandatory. It is expected that competitors stay within the rules and procedures of their own accord and do not require constant policing.
  • If you have a robot or weapon design that does not fit within the categories set forth in these rules or is in some way ambiguous or borderline, please contact the event organizers.
  • All weapons must have a safety cover on any sharp edges

Dimensions and Fabrications:
  • The bot should fit in a box of maximum dimension 40 cm x 40 cm x 40 cm (lxbxh) with all mechanisms fully executing motions. Length and width is measured to the extremities of the Robot, i.e. includes any overhanging bodywork, weaponry or protrusions. The external device used to control the bot is not included in the size constraint.
  • Maximum weight of the bot should not exceed 10kgs. (including battery)

Mobility: All bots must have easily visible and controlled mobility in order to compete. Methods of mobility include:
  • Movement of robot must be rolling of wheels only.
  • Jumping and hopping is not allowed.
  • Flying (using air foil, helium balloons, ornithopters, etc. is not allowed.

Robot Control Requirements:
  • If the bot is wired then the wire should remain slack under all circumstances during the competition. All the wires coming out of the bot should be stacked as a single unit. The wires should be properly insulated. Teams are suggested to use only rated wires such as ISI marked. Loose connections or improper wiring may lead to direct disqualification even before the event.
  • If the bot is controlled wirelessly, the bot must at least have a four frequency remote control circuit or two dual control circuits which may be interchanged before the start of the race to avoid frequency interference with other teams. The case of any interference in the wireless systems will not be considered for rematch or results.
  • Remote control systems from toys might be used. Remote control systems available in the market may also be used.

Battery and Power:
  • The machine can be powered electrically only. Batteries must be sealed, immobilized- electrolyte types (such as Li-ion, NiCd, NiMH or dry cells).
  • Working voltages must not exceed 24V DC (mean voltage) at any point of time.
  • All power connections must be of an adequate grade and adequately insulated. Cables must be routed to minimize the chances of being cut.
  • All efforts must be made to protect battery terminals from a direct short and causing a battery fire, failure to do so will cause direct disqualification.
  • Battery Eliminators are allowed and power source would be available at the venue for the eliminators.
Motors: The robot should move as fast as possible around the arena with the help of motors. DC motors and stepper motors (12V-24V) can be used as per the design of bots
Note: We are not responsible for any damage that your bot may incur during the event.

Score Card: The score card is based upon the arena formulation. It is obvious that the robot with an extraordinary dynamism will succeed by thrusting out its combatant from the Arena.If one of the robots, Say A, pushes its rival out of the white band to the respective colour bands shown below, the robot A will gain points as follows.
  1. Green band – 5 points.
  2. Red band – 20 points. The red band will consists of bumpers.
  3. Blue band – 50 points. The blue band will be a rough terrain consisting of sand and pebbles.
  4. If a robot is pushed beyond the slope, the round ends and the other team is awarded the points.
Ultimately, if any of the combatants rolls out from the entire Arena it will directly be eliminated from the War Field.

Criteria for Triumph
  • A robot will be declared immobile if it cannot demonstrate linear motion of at least one inch in a timed period of 30 seconds.
  • A bot with one side of its drive train disabled will not be counted out if it can demonstrate some degree of controlled movement.
  • If both robots survive the 5 minutes, the robot with the higher scorecard points wins.
  • The winner advances to the next round while the loser is eliminated from the tournament.

gear up.title: Indoor Grand Prix
gear up.description:
So maybe your favourite place to be is indoors. You hate the pollution; you’re far too refined to seek pleasure in exhaust smoke or perfectly executed drifts. You envision yourself in a Tesla, in equilibrium with your surroundings.

We’d love to have you on-board at the Indoor Grand Prix, as you duel with your peers, to prove your prowess, and with petrol-heads, to prove a point.

Maneuvre through our maze!!!!
rules:
Track Specification
  • Two identical tracks for the participating teams to compete separately in the initial round and against each other in the knockout stages.
  • The track will include sharp turns, obstacles and loops.
  • The two tracks will be combined into one for the final round.
Note:
  • Penalties will be specified ON SPOT
  • Should bring your own tools
  • Use the same car for all the rounds

Time Trial
  • This round will be a time trial, in which each team will be allowed to ride their cars on the track for a lap; the time taken to complete the lap will be recorded and ranked.
  • The faster you finish, the better will be your chances to qualify for the knockout round.

Knockout
  • Teams will compete against each other in twos, in two identical tracks. The winner stays in contention while the losing team is eliminated.
  • Races will continue to happen between the teams ranked first and last in the points table. The top two teams from the knockout round will compete in the finals.

Grand Finale
  • The two tracks will be combined into a single one for the final round. The details of this round will be given on spot.
  • Winner will be awarded the Bounty

Specifications
  • The car should not exceed 30x30 cm (length x width) in dimensions.
  • 12 volt, 5A On-board battery
  • The vehicle should be able to climb obstacles and run on slippery surfaces.
  • Track width is 44 cm.

gear up.title: Mechathlon
gear up.description: The more you think about it, the more you want to be a mechanical engineer. But, you lack a forum to fully showcase your adept grasp on the subject. For you whiz kids, Mechathlon is the perfect event. Tackle the wide range of questions put forth, and compete with the very best. Step up, and come forward, for the world needs to have a taste of your knowledge.
rules: This is an event that happens in three stages.
All participants who have registered for the event will take a preliminary quiz consisting of 15 MCQs. The allotted time is 20 min.
The preliminary quiz will be evaluated by volunteers and a merit list will be formed. In case of a tie, the starred questions will be used to break it.
The top 8 to 12 candidates will qualify for the next round, which is a Group Discussion (GD).
The GD will be presided over by a professor. It will either be a GD of 1 group with 8 members or 2 groups of 6 members each.
The performance of participants in the GD will be evaluated by the faculty.
On a scale of 0 to 1, the weightage for the prelims quiz is 0.7, and the weightage for GD is 0.3.
A revised merit list will be drafted after the GD; the top 4 - 6 candidates will be eligible for the Final Interview.
The panellists for the interview will be 3 faculty members (one each from the three broad areas of Manufacturing, Design and Thermal).
The panellists will unanimously decide the winner and the runners-up based on the performance in the interview.
timings: Prelims: 9th September 2016 at 1 p.m and 10th September 2016 at 9 a.m

gear up.title: Outdoor Grand Prix
gear up.description: The growling, power hungry automobile whizzes past you, its tyres drifting across the tarmac. The smell of burning rubber, with sparks flying off the road, pumps you and you are gunning to take down the terrain that dares to challenge you… Have you ever had dreams like that? If so, Outdoor Grand Prix, now bigger and better than ever before, is the event for you. With a challenging track to tackle, consisting of numerous towering obstacles in your path, channel the inner racer in you and drive your car to glory. Your racing dream begins right here.
rules:
Track Specification
  • The track will be off-road with obstacles, slopes and tunnels.
  • The width of the track will be intimated on spot.
Only cars powered by internal combustion engines are allowed to compete. Electric or solar powered cars will not be allowed under any circumstances.
Maximum allowable displacement for IC engines is 4.6cc.
Only nitro-based fuels or gasoline should be used in the cars.
For nitro-based fuels, the amount of nitro compounds in the mixture should not exceed 25%.
Fuel will not be provided by the organizers. Teams must bring their own.
Only buggy type cars are allowed
The cars should fit in a box of dimensions 500mm x 400mm x300mm. The antenna used for radio control is exempted from height restrictions.

Participants are advised to have multi-channel radio controllers to prevent frequency clashes. Transmitters with FHSS - Frequency Hop Spread Spectrum are allowed. Organizers will not be responsible for any interference in frequencies.
Batteries will not be provided. Contestants must bring sufficient number of batteries.

Both ready-to-run kit cars and custom fabricated cars are allowed to compete. Special prizes might be awarded for cars with maximum number of custom fabricated parts. Participants are required to submit an abstract containing the details of the parts fabricated to the email id mentioned below before the day of the event.
The abstract must contain photographs of the parts fabricated. All other technical specifications of the car must be included in the abstract.
Organizers have the right to stop a car from competing if it is found to be unsafe.
Time penalties for cars leaving the track are at the sole discretion of the organizers. Details of the penalties will be revealed on the day of the event.

Participants will be given time for setting up their car before the commencement of the first round. Each team gets one practice lap on the track. Requests for additional trial runs on the actual track will not be entertained.

Organizers will not be responsible for accidental collisions during the head to head race. Teams deliberately trying to obstruct another vehicle are subject to disqualification. The final decision rests with the organizers in this regard.

A pedestal will be provided for drivers to control their vehicles. Drivers are prohibited from running around the track along with the car. The track may contain challenging blind spots that are not clearly visible to the driver.
Only two track marshals per team will be allowed on the track (on the outside) to restore the cars leaving the track.
Participants will have to forfeit the competition if they face any technical issues with their vehicle. Additional time will not be provided once the event starts.
Abstracts to be sent to: dineshkumar13306@mech.ssn.edu.in or mathan13054@mech.ssn.edu.in

gear up.title: Project Exhibition
gear up.description: “If God exists, he is definitely an engineer”, and nowhere is this more evident than when we engineers do what we were born to do- Create. The project exhibition at SSN is a stage for all you creators- whether you obsess over the tiniest details of your brainchild or coast on a vision bigger than the universe itself. Come, join us in this celebration of human ingenuity!
rules:
General Details
  • Projects must fit in one of the following three streams: Design, Thermal (includes projects related to alternate fuels and renewable energy) or Manufacturing & Production.
  • Each team can have a maximum of 4 members.
  • Participants cannot be part of more than one team.
  • A team cannot exhibit more than one project.

Prelims
  • Every team must submit a two page (A4 size) report of their project work.
  • The report should include a brief write up on the following: project definition (problem statement or aim), methodology adopted (should provide basic information on calculations, fabrication method employed etc.) and conclusion (brief on the final outcome of the project)
  • Last date for submitting the preliminary report (by e-mail) is 1st September 2015. The results of the selection will be intimated to the teams by 1st September 2015.

Finals
  • The teams selected in the prelims will present their project on the event day, in a space allocated to them.
  • Teams can use visual aids such as flex banners and charts for presentation. (Maximum Size of Visual aids: 2x2 feet).
  • It is advised that the visual aids include the following topics:
    1. Problem Definition
    2. Design Calculation and Methodology
    3. Fabrication Process and Method
    4. Results and Discussion
    5. Conclusion
  • More points will be given for inclusion of visual content such as flowcharts, graphs and elements to aid easier understanding.
  • Each team will exhibit the working of the projects to the judges.
  • Aids required to present the working (such as pipes, tubes, in case of any projects involving fluids) should be brought by the respective teams.
  • Teams can utilize the electricity and plumbing facilities available in the department.
  • Teams submitting projects are allowed to show a video of the working where actual working cannot be shown on the day of the event. However, preference will be given to teams who can demonstrate the working.
  • Teams will be evaluated for the following:
    1. Originality (5 points)
    2. Ease of Implementation (5 points)
    3. Conceptual Clarity (5 points)
    4. Working and desired results (5 points)
    5. Innovation (5 points)
    6. Overall adherence to the format prescribed( A4, Visual aids etc,) (5 points)
    Total- 30 points
  • The two best projects will be awarded.
Send your project abstract to ramsharma13318@mech.ssn.edu.in

catalyst.title: Pin It Up!
catalyst.description:
If you are the kind of person who can’t do slides, this is for you. Turn your paper into a colourful and illustrative poster adhering to the guidelines. Give a brief explanation about the content to our judges and stand a chance to win exciting prizes!
TOPICS FOR POSTER
  1. Environment and Energy
  2. Catalysis and Reaction Engineering
  3. Sustainability
  4. Food, Pharmaceutical and Biotechnology
  5. Separations
  6. Fuels and Petrochemicals
  7. Materials Engineering and Sciences
  8. Transport Phenomena
  9. Process Simulation and Modelling
  10. Material Technology
  11. Nanotechnology
  12. Safety Management and other related topics
rules: RULES AND REGULATIONS
Maximum of 3 participants are allowed per presentation.
Abstracts should not exceed 200 words.
First page of the abstract must contain the Title of the Paper and author’s full postal address, email id, mobile number.
A space of 75*60 cm2 will be provided for your poster display.
Judges’ decision is final and binding.
Send your abstracts to arvind.anthony@gmail.com
The file name should be the title of your paper.
The subject of the mail should be 'POSTER PRESENTATION – PARTICIPANTS NAMES'.
Last day for submission of abstracts : 4th September 2016

catalyst.title: Working Model
catalyst.description:
Two dimensional diagrams on the texts are passé! In the age of printers who wants to learn from static images? Break out of the paper and build us a working model for any of the following topics and explain briefly to our panel of judges. The models will be judged based on
  1. The design of the model
  2. Operating cost and efficiency.
  3. Concepts involved and explanation.

TOPICS FOR WORKING MODEL:
  1. Pumps
  2. Recovery of Chemicals
  3. Waste water treatment
  4. Utilization of Waste materials
  5. A study on Electrochemical reactions
  6. Alternative sources of Energy
  7. Biochemical Projects(Biogas, Bio-fuel, Biomass production)
  8. Condensation mechanism
  9. Effluent Treatment in petroleum refinery
  10. Desalination system
  11. Extraction process
  12. Corrosion study
  13. Pollution control
  14. Energy Resources conservation
  15. Environmental Health
  16. Safety in industries
rules: An abstract should to be submitted by each team on or before with the below mentioned details.
Name of the participants (Maximum 4), their Email ID, contact number
Institution/College to which they belong
Team name
Properly labeled schematic diagram of the model.
Specification of chemical reactants used and reactions used (if any).
A short explanation of the mechanism.
Quantify the cost of each material used in the model.
Send your abstracts to prapakathir@gmail.com
Last date of submission: 4th September 2016

N.B: The judges’ decision will be final no discrepancies will be encouraged. No second attempts will be permitted. Participants can be from any department. They can be of same or different institutions. No participants should register in more than one team. In that case the teams would be disqualified.

catalyst.title: Crossfire
catalyst.description: Tech savvy, gizmo guru in the world of chemical technology, the goto person. If you are any one of the above, this quiz is for you. Polish your intellectual armour and come prepared. Get ready to battle it out over 4 gruelling rounds as we put you to test.
rules: Round 1:Preliminary pen and paper test
Round 2:Finals consisting of 3 rounds in itself

catalyst.title: Chemcrypto
catalyst.description: Are you an ardent fan of Dan Brown’s Digital Fortress and Da Vinci Code? Do you love chemical engineering unit operations? If yes to both, then you are “perfect” to take part in this event. Crack the code and answer the questions that follow and emerge as the winner.
rules:
RULES AND REGULATIONS
  • Maximum of 3 members are allowed per team.
  • All the team members can/cannot be from the same institution. Cross teams are allowed.
  • Every team will be given a set of puzzles. The number of questions they crack in the given time will be considered for deciding the winner.
  • Use of electronic gadgets while attending the event is strictly prohibited and will lead to disqualification of the team.
  • The decision taken by event organisers is final.

catalyst.title: Chanakya's Pitch
catalyst.description: Come up with an innovative idea for your start-up – in accordance with the  theme of a GREEN industry. The company you propose should be in the field of Chemical Engineering Industry and should differ essentially from the existing such industries. On approval of your abstract you would be invited to pitch your start-up to us, in the presence of judges from varied fields. You would be marked on the extent of your differentiation and innovation, the greenness of your industry and your financial plans for it.
rules: The abstract you submit for our prior consideration should contain the following details:
A brief description of your start-up and its purpose.
Its need in the present age.
A proposed location for establishing your start-up.
The GREEN aspect and uniqueness of your industry.
A brief technical description of the processes that take place in your industry – right from the inventory, raw material stage to the finished product, distribution stage.
Your ideas to obtain financial aid to run your start-up.
Your innovative ideas to market your own product.
Send your abstracts to: rohitnarayanan95@gmail.com
Last day for submission of abstracts: 4th September 2016

catalyst.title: Fantasy Chemical League
catalyst.description: Who said chemical engineers were all about lab coats and safety goggles? We are just as good at taking stock of wall street as we are at handling test tubes. We bring to you fantasy chemical league where we combine the best of both worlds, management and engineering. Are you ready to dabble numbers, crunch some stocks and produce at the same time? This event plays upon only virtual things. There is a lot to win with no investment, “BRAIN” exception!!!.
rules:
RULES AND REGULATIONS:
  • The game proceeds in sessions. Each session lasts for 45 minutes.
  • This is a team event. Each team consists of 3 members.
  • Raw materials and licence are first come first served basis.
  • Have a prior knowledge about Chemical licence and marketing procedure in India (GST?!).
  • Decision of the organising board is final.
  • Winners will be notified through email id and phone call.

catalyst.title: Mystery Project
catalyst.description: How good are you at cooking up something on spot? We put you on a task to test your presence of mind and mastery over simple concepts in the most interesting way possible. Come unprepared and experience the gusto... Apply some logic and techie stuff to build what we ask for. That is it! We give you the material. You are only required to build your project.
rules:
RULES AND REGULATIONS:
  • Maximum of 3 members are allowed per team.
  • All the team members can/cannot be from the same institution.Cross teams are allowed.
  • Use of electronic gadgets while attending the event is strictly prohibited and will lead to disqualification of the team.
  • The decision taken by event organisers is final.

medimorphosis.title: Biogonize
medimorphosis.description: Tired of filling pages and pages to prove your knowledge in biology? Well, here is an opportunity to prove your talent without having to fill 42 pages! And guess what? We evaluate content! We evaluate only once!  And we give you what you deserve!  Sounds rejuvenating, doesn’t it?! So there you go! Don’t forget to join us on the 9th of September at INVENTE V1.0!
rules: Preliminary round description:It will be a paper and pen quiz which will contain 25 questions that test your basic biology knowledge.

Intermediate round description:Eight best teams will be selected for the second round. In the second round 4 visual clues that are related to the same term will be given. The team which identifies the correct word first will be given the points.

Final round description:Out of the 8 teams, 4 finalists will be selected. In round 3, a set of 7 words will be given to one of the participants of each team. This participant has to give one word clues so that the other team member identifies the words correctly. Only 3 clues can be given per word and only one guess is allowed per clue. The fastest team that identifies all the words correctly will be declared as the winner.

medimorphosis.title: Bioquest
medimorphosis.description: Do you consider yourself an aspiring entrepreneur nipped in the bud by engineering? Have you been waiting for that dormant business animal to unleash itself? Wait no more because BIOQUEST beckons. Turn up at the Biomedical Department and find out just how good you are.
rules:
General rules and regulations:
  • Each team can have two or three members.
  • Cross college teams are allowed.
  • ID card is compulsory for the participants.
  • Decision of judges and event coordinators are final and binding to all.

Preliminary round (Round 1):
  • Each member from a team will come forth and pick a chit that has different domains related to Biomedical engineering/ Biotechnology. The domains for biomedical include: bioinstrumentation, clinical engineering, biomaterials,biomedical waste management, bio statistics and the domains for biotechnology include: bioinformatics, pharmaceuticals, environmental biotechnology , cancer biology, genetic engineering
  • The team will get questions based on the domain they have chosen throughout the event.
  • There will be ten MCQ questions and one problem statement which has to be answered in brief within 40 minutes.

Final round description (Round 2):
  • One team from each domain will move into the finals.
  • Each team will get one evening to prepare their presentation on the problem statement they have answered in the previous round.
  • They have to present it with the perspective of an entrepreneur.
  • The team which is able to convince the judges will be declared winner.

medimorphosis.title: LudaQuiz
medimorphosis.description: Let’s sprinkle some of that wizarding world magic and have an ‘Organic Board Game’ transpire. Álohomora your way into a massive game of Ludo and intense quizzing and maybe brew a big cauldron of fun at LudaQuiz.
rules:
General rules and regulations:
  1. The game, as the name indicates, will be a mix of the traditional board game, Ludo, and a technical quiz. It will be a tournament-style event so get ready for heart-pumping excitement.
  2. The event will consist of three rounds- The Prelims and The Knockouts, and The Finale. Participants will be allowed to either play alone or in groups of 2.

Preliminary round (Round 1):The Prelims stage will consist of a paper-based technical quiz, where the participants are made to complete the quiz within 30 minutes. The prelims will start from 10:30AM and continue until 12:00 PM. This is to ensure ample time is present for the participants who register late. There will be 30 questions in the paper, all in MCQ format. Each correct answer will be given a +1 and wrong answers will be given 0. From this, 16 teams will be selected for The Knockouts.

Knockout round description (Round 2):This is where the tournament style kicks in, dwelling on the ever-thrilling format of knockout matches. The knockouts will blend the fun board game, Ludo, with the usual technical quiz. In this stage, there will be two games happening simultaneously in two ludo boards. Each team will be drawn in random and a bracket will be established. 4 teams choose a colour by drawing chits, and act as the set pieces in the game. Each team will be posed with an initial question. On answering it, one member may exit the start area, and progress towards the end. After this, all the questions will contain answers that have the length of words between 1 and 6. These answers are analogous to the dice numbers 1 to 6. Upon answering, the participant may move steps equal to the number of words. If answered wrong, the participant is not allowed to move. The team that has all its members reach the finish line wins. In the event that a player steps onto the tile of another idle player, the idle player has to go back to the start position. The top team will be chosen from each match. These four teams will get to advance to The Finale.

Final round description (Round 3):Same rules, same game, but higher stakes, and even higher difficulty, as teams face-off to win three cash prizes. The Finale will pose a serious challenge to the teams, as they must be on their feet, to respond quickly to the questions posed.
medimorphosis.venue: Diagonistic and Therapeutic Equipments Lab - Second Floor (BME Dept)

medimorphosis.title: Masterpiece
medimorphosis.description: In a sea of the ordinary, stand out and let your brilliant ideas surface as we uncover your technical skills in the most artistic and colorful way, here at Masterpiece!
rules:
General rules and regulations:
  1. All the materials such as agar, pour plates, clay, gloves and masks, bacterial inoculum will be provided.
  2. Maximum of 3 numbers per team.
  3. Contestants must bring their own stationery.

Preliminary round description:
Streaks
Inoculate artistic streaking on a agar filled pour plate and display your knowledge of culture media streaking techniques.
Duration:30 minutes

Intermediate round description:
Pictionary
A guessing game where players identify the word from the picture drawn by one of their team member.
Duration:90 minutes

Final round description:
Biomimetics
Matching of a natural object with its real time applications including identification of logos for instruments and Biomedical companies.
Duration:60 minutes
medimorphosis.venue: M.E 2nd year classroom - Second Floor (BME Dept)

medimorphosis.title: Scintelligence
medimorphosis.description: Feel the adrenaline rush, as we test your technical knowledge and skill with brain games. Get ready to discover some unexplored territory.
rules:
Preliminary round description:
Crack it up
  1. Each team will have two members.
  2. They will be made to crack the word hidden in pictorial clues.
  3. There will be a total of 5 questions.
  4. Every right answer gets two points.
  5. Duration: 1 hour.

Intermediate round description(Semifinals):
  1. Knick Knack:
    1. Each team can have two members.
    2. They will have to unscramble the given words and link them up to find the underlying concept.
    3. There will be a total of 3 questions.
    4. Every right answer gets two points.
    5. Duration:30 minutes.
  2. Cat's tail:
    1. Each team will have two members.
    2. The team members will be asked to analyze the given picture, and guide their blind folded partner to identify the correct spot.
    3. There will be a total of 2 questions posed.
    4. Every right answer will be awarded 2 points.
    5. Duration: 30 minutes.

Finals:
  1. Gravitics:
    1. Each team will have two members
    2. They’ll have to solve the problem within time limit which is decided by their partner's balancing skill.
    3. There will be a total of 3 questions.
    4. Every right answer gets two points.
    5. Duration: 30 minutes.
  2. Impulse:
    1. Each team will have two members.
    2. They’ll have to help their partner find the words by giving clues.
    3. Every word is allowed 3 clues.
    4. There will be a total of 5 questions.
    5. Every right answer gets two points
    6. Duration: 30 minutes.
medimorphosis.venue: Diagonistic and Therapeutic Equipments Lab - Second Floor (BME Dept)

medimorphosis.title: Tellurians
medimorphosis.description: Tellurians, the tenants of the Earth, let's resolve the puzzles over the evolution!!!. Take part and feel the pleasure of being a human !!!
rules:
Preliminary round description:
Online quiz related to areas:
  • Medical biology
  • Medical devices.

Each section will comprise of 10 easy questions, 5 medium question and 3 hard questions. Easy and medium questions will be MCQs. The hard questions will involve finding the odd one out, matching or identifying the unknowns. Ten teams will be shortlisted.

Intermediate round description:
Tie In-Flavoured Connections
Only three teams will be shortlisted for the next round. The common term linking the pictures presented has to be identified. Each team will get a maximum of three questions. In the event of a tie, a tie breaker will be established.

Final round description:
Muckrakes
A clue will be given to a member of the team and the rest of the team has to find the word by means of Dumb Charades. The team as a whole will then have to discover the physical object described by the clue by searching the room.
medimorphosis.venue: M.E 1st year classroom - Ground Floor (BME Dept)

medimorphosis.title: Poster Presentation - Papyrus
medimorphosis.description: Here’s something for all the tech savvy and creative engineers out there. Pour all your innovative ideas onto a single sheet of chart. Visually present your concepts and win cash prizes!
rules:
General rules and regulations:
  • The posters that adhere to the topics given are alone expected.
  • The abstract for the poster must reach before the deadline. Abstracts reaching us after deadline will not be accepted.
  • Not more than 3 members can constitute in a team.

Preliminary round description:
  • The posters should be based on one of the following topics.
    • Biomedical sciences
    • Biotechnology
    • Medical image processing
    • Biometrics
    • Biomechanics
    • Healthcare technology
    • Artificial intelligence
    • Nanotechnology
    • Biomedical instrumentation
    • Biomaterials and Artificial organs
  • The abstracts will be processed by the committee members. The deserving candidates will be called for the final round to present their posters.
  • A maximum of 8 teams will be selected for the final round.

Final round description:
  • The candidates are expected to present the posters. The poster must include the following:
    • Title
    • Names of author(s) and affiliated organization(s)
    • Abstract (brief summary of objectives, methods, results, and conclusions)
    • Background Information
    • Project Objectives
    • Materials and Methods
    • Results (tables, graphs, charts)
    • Conclusions
    • Discussion of possible future directions or why project is complete
  • Competitors shall plot the poster on a 46”x56” sheet of paper
  • All illustrations and text must be readable from a distance of 3 feet
  • This round will be judged by the subject experts.
Deadline for submission: 31st August 2016
medimorphosis.venue: Project Incubation Cell - First Floor (BME Dept)

medimorphosis.title: VR Workshop
medimorphosis.description: The pokemon go game made us all crazy, revived our old memories and created a new community. And yet the geek in us made us wonder how the cute little pikachu or fire - breathing charmander pops up in our surroundings out of nowhere. If you're one among them ,  then you would be happy to learn that ieee Embs is offering you a portal into the brains behind VR and AR at INVENTE on the 10 th of September. Be there and be amazed.
rules: The participants are expected to carry a laptop with connectivity to WiFi and Unity-3D (free VR software) installed.

Workshop fee is as follows:
  • Individuals- Rs.700
  • Team of 2 - Rs.800
  • Team of 3 – Rs.900
Certificates and VR kits(one per team) will be provided.

Session 1:

The session will kick off with a brief introduction to Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality. It will delve into the details of the conceptualization of AR and VR.

Session 2:

Resuming after lunch break, it will be a hands-on session teaching the contestants the intricacies of Unity-3D and assisting them in learning the software.
Click this link to register.

structured.title: Bridge - IT!
structured.description: Simple engineering with a twist of design, Bridge IT is one of the biggest hands on event of Invente. A challenging and fascinating problem statement to transform the sedentary into working models. This event is the real test of your creativity and knowledge with civil engineering putting your grey cells into work!
rules:
The Event will consist of two rounds.
  • The QUESTIONNAIRE Round
  • The FINALE

The Questionnaire round is basically the prelims. Participants will be asked to take up a test where questions will be asked from topics related to Bridges, trusses etc. The test comprises multiple choice questions.
Based on the marks obtained, selected participants will qualify to the next and the final round which is The FINALE.

In the Finale, the participants will be asked to make models of bridges. The strength of the bridge will be tested by load application and the participant whose bridge withstands more load will be declared the winner.
Only two students are permitted per team.
All the materials needed for making the bridge will be provided by us.
The dimensions of the bridge will be specified and participants should stick to   it.
Load will be applied only on the deck of the bridge.
Any participant violating all these rules will be disqualified.

structured.title: Concrete Challenge
structured.description: What is the most widely used material? Google for the answer…. It is indeed Concrete!!!! We want our participants to play around with the proportions of the constituent components of concrete. Concrete Challenge is back this year with more fun and a realistic problem statement which requires a decent understanding of concrete mix proportions, appropriate mold and aesthetics .In addition to reports and posters or presentations, we expect our participants to be more practical and innovative.
rules:
FORMAT:
  • The participants are expected to bring the cubes casted by them on the day of event.
  • The cubes will be tested for strength and other properties in the Concrete Technology Lab at SSN College of Engineering.
  • Judgement Criteria:
    Total score = S1 + S2 +S3 = 100 marks
    • S1-Pre Qualification (within the given density of concrete) - 10 marks
    • S2-Report - 10 marks
    • S3-Compressive Strength – 80 marks

RULES:
  • Light weight Concrete with a density of 1400 - 1600 kg/m3 must be used to obtain the highest possible achievable strength.
  • Artificial light weight aggregates such as thermocole beads and new tech such as aerated and foamed concrete can be used.
  • Dimension of concrete cubes (LWH): 100mm*100mm*100mm cubes are mandatory.
  • 7-day compressive strength test will be conducted and team with the maximum compressive strength cube will be the winner.
  • A logo will be sent by us to all the participants seven days before the competition and that logo must be kept inside the concrete cubes while casting, as a reference and it is mandatory. Participants without these logo will not be permitted in the competition.
  • Student should form teams of 2 to 4 members.
  • Team participating in the event should have a supervisor, who must be a registered faculty member of any engineering college recognized by Government of India.
  • Students must carry their college ID card throughout the event.
  • Please keep checking the website and your mails for further updates.
  • Failure to abide by any of the above rules will lead to disqualification from the event.
  • Event coordinators and managing Professor’s decision is / are final and binding
  • Abstract of your design should be sent on or before 4th September 2016 (11:59pm) to concretechallenge.civil@gmail.com, duly signed by the supervisor
  • A copy of the abstract should be bought on the day of event.
  • UPDATE: Participants can download the logo from our website for casting the cube

structured.title: In-QUIZ-itive - NV3k
structured.description: A Platform to retrieve information effortlessly from your memory, The main motto of this event is not only to test want you have learned, but also to motivate you to learn more. It is an inkling, to all enthusiastic learners the way to see their deficits and prompt them to work on it. Now, gear up yourselves to hold the fundamentals at your fingertips.
rules:
FORMAT:
  • It is a TECHNICAL QUIZ event, where the final round will be conducted like the very famous program Kaun Banega Crorepati (Neengalum Vellalam Oru Kodi)
  • The event consists of three rounds:
    • Prelims
    • Knockouts
    • The HOT SEAT - Finals
  • The finals will be a replica of the TV program with prize money at every stage and lifelines to help you out.
Entry Fee: Rs. 50

RULES:
  1. We are restricting the number of participants to 100 (first come first basis)
  2. The prelims round, is a buzzer round, where you will be given 5 questions. From this the best 20 will be promoted to the knockouts round.
  3. The knockout round rules will be provided on the spot.
  4. The qualified participants to the Final round, get a chance to be on the Hot Seat and win the cash prize for every right question answered by them.
  5. The question split up and prize money will be showcased on the day of event.
(The participants are expected to have knowledge about various principles, aspects and advancements in civil engineering.)

structured.title: Perfect Civil Engineer
structured.description:
“Scientists study the world as it is; Engineers create the world that has never been.”
It takes an extraordinary mind to create miracles from bricks and stones. Come explore the depth of your civil engineering knowledge with us in “Perfect Civil Engineer”. Know your strengths and ability to think on your feet, to provide technical solutions to various field related problems.
rules:
Format:
  • Round 1 Technical Quiz (preliminay round): Time: 30 minutes, Questions: 20 MCQS
  • Round 2: Picture Mart. Identify the picture as per the question.
  • Round 3: “SURPRISE” round (final round)

RULES:
  1. Group of minimum 2 and maximum of 3 members.
  2. Team members must be from the same college.
  3. Everyone should carry their College ID cards.
  4. Participants found copying or violating any rules will be directly disqualified.

structured.title: Poster Presentation
structured.description: An academic poster is a summary of your research or project in a visually engaging way. A poster session has the potential to reach larger numbers of people than a typical oral presentation.  It is usually a mixture of a brief text mixed with tables, graphs, pictures, and figures. For those of you who like being creative, this is just the event for you!
rules:
PRE-SELECTION ROUND:
  • The pre-selection round will start from 20th August 2016. In order to take part in the event, participants need to register on the INVENTE 2K16 website.
  • Once registered, an abstract of the project or topic (150-250 words) is to be sent to the organizing team based on which the participants will be shortlisted.
  • The abstracts should be mailed to poster.civil@gmail.com on or before 29th August 2016 (11:59pm).
  • The shortlisted participants will be notified via mail on 31st August 2016.
  • The selected participants should mail their completed posters to the team before 4th September 2016 (11:59pm).

FINAL ROUND:
  • The selected participants should report at the venue on 9 th September, 2016 with their full size posters.
  • Duration of 5 minutes will be allotted for presentation of the poster and 3 minutes for queries.
  • Participant(s) will be judged on the basis of technical content of poster, creativity, presentation skills and format.
  • Note that all participants who took part in the event are requested to report at the venue on 9 th September, 2016 for collecting their participation certificates.

POSTER FORMAT:
  1. Topic – Any research topic or project regarding civil engineering.
  2. Poster size – A3 size.
  3. The poster can be either handmade or printed.
  4. Font style – Times New Roman.
  5. Font size – 20 to 28
  6. The poster should be oriented in the ‘landscape’ position.
  7. Appropriate title should be provided. The name of the participant(s), name of college should be included in the poster.
  8. Paragraphs and texts should be avoided. Use bullets.
  9. Use figures, diagrams, graphics, or easy-to-read tables to explain/illustrate ideas or findings.
  10. Graphic materials should be visible easily from a minimum distance of 6 feet.

RULES:
  1. Maximum of 2 participants are permitted per team.
  2. The participant(s) should mail their posters to poster.civil@gmail.com before 29th August along with an abstract in about 150-250 words.
  3. The selected teams will be intimated before 31st August.
  4. Duration of 5 minutes will be allotted for presentation of the poster and 3 minutes for queries.
  5. Participant(s) will be judged on the basis of technical content of poster, creativity, presentation skills and format.

structured.title: Potential Professor
structured.description:
Do you think you have an inherent quality to get a grip of the concepts and elucidate them to others in an interesting and clear way?
Then, here comes the most awaited event of the SSN Techfest – INVENTE, just right for the vibrant minds – “POTENTIAL PROFEESOR”.
Do you believe that interactive and fun teaching is the correct way to get the concepts right into the minds of the students?

Here is a platform to experiment and showcase your teaching skills. Unleash your potential, prepare yourself to become a future professor.
rules: Pre-registrations and spot registrations are allowed.
There will be two rounds in this event.
First round will be a group discussion, topics for it will be general topics. Around 10-15 students shortlisted will move on to the second round.
Selected candidates will be given a choice of topics to choose from for which they can prepare during the given time and teach the concepts in the best way possible.
Participants will be given 1 hour 30 minutes time and required resources i.e., books for them to prepare on their topics.
Participants have to present their topic to the judges and the audience in about 15 minutes.
Chalk and board method can be used to present the topic.
Judges and Coordinators' decision will be final.
You will be judged for your teaching skills, question and problem solving ability, clarity and adherence to time.

structured.title: Civilian's Tech Hunt
structured.description: Buckle up to discover  the treasure with all that you have learnt in college. Tech hunt is a combination of several clues and fun activities and a lots of exciting prizes to win!
rules: The Tech Hunt will start at the same time for all contesting teams at the venue provided.
Interesting clues, missions and activities  will be provided on spot and it will take place just like any other Treasure Hunt.
Clues of every team are different and located at different places but the final destination i.e. the treasure is same .The team which finds the treasure first wins.
Each team must have three members.
All participants should be pursuing their Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering. Other streams cannot participate as the clues will be regarding civil engineering.
A leader has to be selected amongst the team members at the time of registration.
Each team will be allotted a particular name. And all the clues for the team will go by that name.
Wallets, mobile phones and other devices of communication are not allowed.
A member of tech hunt committee will be with each team to confirm that a fair game is played. It is mandatory for each team to keep the committee member with them till the game ends.
The clues are to be found in a particular order. A team cannot skip a clue. Skipping a clue will lead to disqualification of your team.
structured.venue: College Campus, Starting Point - In front of Civil Engineering Department

structured.title: Battle of Designs
structured.description: For any civil engineering project, designing the structure has always been the preliminary stage. It may be the interiors or exteriors - design has always involved creativity, knowledge of all the aspects of civil engineering, principles of designing, customer requirements and various unique features which we develop with experience and practice. Do you think you can match up to these? Are you good with AutoCad? Join us at SSN!
rules: Only individual participation is allowed.
Participants should bring their ID cards.
Prelims will be conducted for 15 minutes and 10 - 15 participants will be qualified to the finals.
Any kind of malpractice will lead to disqualification.

Preliminary Round:
  • An interactive quiz session will take place.
  • The questions will mostly be related to design aspects, softwares used in Civil, plans and drawings etc.

Final Round:
  • The final round will take place in the CADD Lab.
  • Every participant will be given a topic on spot.
  • The participants should use Autodesk AutoCAD to design/draw their design, plans based on their topic.
  • Judges selection will be final.

non tech.title: Mini Militia
non tech.description: Any college event can never be complete, if it doesn’t have any event related to the most famous and the ultimate smartphone game – Mini Militia. This time it is going to be a grand event and probably the first of its kind and with huge prize money. Showcase your talents. Invente is going to give you recognition. You are going to compete with the best teams among the state and we are going to have an ultimate winner. So be there for the battle,folks!
rules: A team should comprise of only three members.
Any member using a hacked version of the game will lead to the disqualification of the entire team.
The timing and the map of the battlefield will be decided by the organizers.
A team can participate again by registering again.
Registration fees for a team is hundred rupees.
Each round will be an elimination round.
Every team should choose their powerplayer. In case of ties, the scores of the powerplayers will be considered to remove any discrepancy.
Players are advised to bring the updated version of the game.

non tech.title: Entertainer of this Era
non tech.description: Do you think you are good enough to be called "Entertainer of this Era"? Fight it out with others and let the world know who the boss is. Create, Share and Win prizes at this event from the popular tech fest, Invente by SSN, hosted on Kevera. Win exciting apple products and internships.
rules: Unleash your Creativity and create as many articles, lists, short posts, pics, videos, social apps and quizzes as possible in www.kevera.com
Show off your work by sharing it with the world and see it go viral.
Students with the highest number of overall post views as on September 9(counted from August 23rd) will be declared as winners

non tech.title: IPL Bidding
non tech.description:
Do you think the IPL auction is as important as the games?
Do you have the ability to recognise potential?
Do you have it in you to build a balanced team and spend wisely?
We have just the event for you!
rules: Team of 2-3 members.
First round will be a cricket related quiz.
Top 8 teams go through to finals.
Rules for finals will be announced on spot.
Entry fee of Rs 30 per team.
Participants can attend any one of the two days as separate events will be conducted on each day

non tech.title: Sherlock Holmes
non tech.description: Ever since your childhood, you must have been fascinated by how the mind of Sherlock Holmes works. This event is the perfect opportunity for you to experience your thoughts in action. An event where you can put your little grey cells to action and prove to everyone that you are as smart as a certain someone who lives in 221B, Baker Street, London.
rules: Prelims will consist of 15 general aptitude questions to be solved in 20 minutes.

Selected teams will move on to the second round, where you will have to solve a crime scene given by us.(If no teams are able to solve the crime scene. the team with the closest answer to the right one will be declared as the winner)
A team can consist maximum of three members and cross-institutional participation is allowed.
Mobile phones are prohibited and the event organisers' decision will be final.
Participants can attend any one of the two days as separate events will be conducted on each day

non tech.title: Crazy Cricket
non tech.description:
Not the technical type of a person?

But a cricket lover instead?

Put no talent to waste. This is the perfect chance for you to showcase your cricketing skills here at Invente along with your friends and win cash prizes.

Don’t miss this wonderful opportunity. Be there!
rules: A team must have 5 players.
Each team has to register with an entry fee of Rs. 50 to participate once.
A team can participate again by registering again.
A team can have both boys and girls.
Every player in the team has to bowl an over

non tech.title: Gaming - Dota2
non tech.description:
Bobo , Tangina mo , putang ina , sohai , 4head , mid or feed …..sounds familiar? Do u think you are the next TI champions or do u think u can become the next miracle kappa.
Come and show us your prowess in this all famous world’s best MOBA game . Show us you are the pro!!!
GAMING IS NOT A CRIME !!!
rules: Registration is separate for each day
Each Team must consist of 5 members
Registration is Rs 50 per head (250 per team)
Every round is a knockout round
Each game will go on for about a maximum of 45 minutes
The Winner is decided based on the number of points scored (The points split-up will be explained in the venue)
The rules can be relaxed in case of hardware/software malfunctions
If a team wins before 45mins then it is declared as winner irrespective of the number of points
A team is also declared winner if GG is called before 45 min
Players are allowed to bring their own equipment (Keyboard,mouse,headphones etc..)
Only Captain’s mode is allowed
Once the draft is made it cannot be changed later on

non tech.title: Gaming - NFS Most Wanted
non tech.description: To be Most Wanted, you’ll need to outrun the cops, outdrive your friends, and outsmart your rivals. With a relentless police force gunning to take you down, you’ll need to make split-second decisions. Your rivals will do everything they can to stop you from getting to the top. In this world, there can only be one Most Wanted.
rules: Tracks will be decided by the organisers
Any cars can be chosen
Round 1: The fastest 16 will make it to the next round
Round 2: 4 separate LAN games and the top 4 will make it to the Finale
Final Round: 1 LAN game for the finalists

non tech.title: Gaming - Counter Strike 1.6
non tech.description: Think you’re the fps king? Is the reload of a gun, music to your ears? Do you have what it takes to be crowned the ultimate champion? Bring your talents to Invente this year to battle it out in a timeless classic.
rules: Registration is valid throughout the first day
A team should consist of 5 members
The registration fee is 50rs per head ( 250 per team )
The event will be conducted in a bracket format
Each matchup will consist of 12 rounds, 6 as terrorists and 6 as counter-terrorists
Each round will be a 1 minute and 45 second cycle on a map
The first team to win 7 rounds out of 12 progresses to the next stage
In case of a tie, 6 extra rounds(3 as terrorists and 3 as counter-terrorists) will be conducted to decide the winner
The semi-final and final matchups will be a best of 3 maps
Sides will be decided by a coin toss
Players may bring their own mousepads and headphones, but keyboards and mice are prohibited
The organizers reserve the right to modify the rules at any time
